channel.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
channel.description:
GUYS, please I need your help. I beg of it. I have been playing runescape private servers for like 2 years now. Sadly when I started fooling with them and making models it messed it up I guess. Whatever the server or client im on no matter if its someone else's client from there website. When I click twice in the client it simply closes. It does give me an error message and I do try and look for it. No one seems to know the fix to this problem.
Things I've tried: Google for hours Redownloading all of JDK and JRE and reinstalling Getting the new version of JRE Deleting all Enviromental Variables that consist of Java in my Path and just deleting my Class Path
Im being as descriptive as I can, if you need some other info feel free to ask. This annoyance has cursed me for to long and Im quite tired of it. I really really wanna play some of the private servers that Ive seen advertised that dont have webclients ( I can play webclients btw).
Any info is needed and wanted.

item.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

at the end of the batch file, add “pause”

run it again, and post your problem in the batch file sticky

Read full topic

item.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

Post the error.
Also you might want to try updating your version of Java. I would also really recommend having the paths set, even if you aren’t going to edit.

Read full topic

Okie doke Ima try that now.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 15, 2009, 06:52:45 pm[/size][hr]That didnt work, still the same problem 2 clicks and then it exited.

item.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
item.dc:creator: @Snaz Snaz
item.description:
@Snaz wrote:

well what i’m thinking is if you really really really wanted to try something that would probably work is go onto your control panel, Click on ‘Users’ and make a new account - then logg of your account and log in on that and download Java if needed and try again. This sould work as I had problems with Clients before until I made a new ‘user’.

Good luck anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year

item.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
item.dc:creator: @frogtamer101 frogtamer101
item.description:
@frogtamer101 wrote:

I don’t have JDK anymore because Im not editing any of that shit. Thats why im saying its probably not the paths. Therefore I cant see a cause to this annoyance

Read full topic
item.source: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year

item.title: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year
item.dc:creator: @hollow_lie hollow lie
item.description:
@hollow_lie wrote:

In you’re Classpath variable you are going to put this.

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

In you’re Path variable put in this

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

Read full topic
item.source: [HALP!] Big Server/Client problem for a year

@frogtamer101 wrote:

GUYS, please I need your help. I beg of it. I have been playing runescape private servers for like 2 years now. Sadly when I started fooling with them and making models it messed it up I guess. Whatever the server or client im on no matter if its someone else’s client from there website. When I click twice in the client it simply closes.
